Neon Thorium

I’m Neth, a web developer who specializes in the MERN stack, but I do a lot of other things too. Thanks for stopping by! I invite you to take a look around and learn more about what I do.

About Me

I’m a guy who likes to walk the line between designer and developer. I like to work in the front-end to make eye-catching designs that anyone can use and in the back-end to turn simple pages into fully functional web applications.

I currently live in Kent with my amazing wife, Ellen, and our two adorable cats.

A career in tech means always learning what’s new. So when I’m not acquiring new skills or putting my existing ones to work, I enjoy making podcasts and videos.

I’m passionate about social justice, retro tech and toys, games, animation, cooking and way too many other things to list here!

Neth Facts:

Test

What I Do

Full Stack Development

Full stack web design with Javascript is my bread and butter. I’ve built several full-stack applications in the MERN stack (that is MongoDB, Express, React, and Node.js) though I’ve also worked with Vue and Angular in the past. I’m always excited to try out new libraries to see what they can do.
• • • •

My Projects

Honest Piranha

This is a landing page I created for my YouTube channel and could be easily adapted to other channels. It can also be used to display blog entries and podcasts. It allows users to log-in and leave comments with a robust moderation system that allows administrators to approve comments before they are displayed. I created a custom admin area that allows administartors to add new entries and series without needing to touch the code.

Learn More View Site View Github
My 90s Notebook

My idea for a social media site with a heavy 90s asthetic. The site allows users to create an account and leave up to six publicly available posts at a time. This was a purposeful decision, as my philosophy behind social media is that posts shouldn't be perminant and that we should be forced to be selective in what we choose to share. I think a system like this could prevent the sort of overload we get from modern social media sites. I plan to update this with more features and perhaps a game.

Learn More View Site View Github
